title: Death Valley National Park: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Be A Junior Ranger         Children can complete Junior Ranger books and earn a badge! Kurt Moses.  Want to have fun while exploring Death Valley?  You can become a JUNIOR RANGER! Here are the things you will need to do: 1) Pick up a free activity booklet at Furnace Creek Visitor Center, or print one off here:   Mid-April to Mid-October:  Summer Booklet (663 KB PDF) Mid-October to Mid-April:  Winter Booklet (999 KB PDF)   2) Complete the right number of activities for your age.  Once you finish your booklet, bring it to Furnace Creek Visitor Center. A park ranger will check your booklet and you will receive your official badge. Once you're done, you can also buy a patch at the visitor center bookstore.   Join a park ranger for a guided hike or ranger talk during the fall, winter or spring seasons.  Stop by the visitor center in Furnace Creek to check on times and locations.
